value: Arkansas specialty courts operate under the judiciary (AOC) rather than the Department of Human Services.  Programs must be included in a judicial circuit’s administrative plan and approved by the Supreme Court; they are funded through legislative appropriations (Specialty Court Program Fund and Accountability Court Fund), federal grants and local fees rather than Medicaid.
notes: Statutes and administrative orders show that specialty court programs are approved by the Supreme Court and overseen by the Specialty Court Program Advisory Committee.  Appropriation acts provide direct funding to the AOC, indicating that specialty courts bypass DHS/Medicaid funding streams.
